questions.question: Describe your product in a few sentences. What problem does it solve?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Our product is a team collaboration tool that helps remote teams stay organized and communicate effectively.

questions.question: What is the ultimate 'user endgame' for your product? What success looks like for your users?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Teams can complete projects efficiently with clear communication and no missed deadlines.

questions.question: What are the top 3 challenges new users face when starting with your product?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Setting up the workspace, inviting team members, creating their first project.

questions.question: What challenges do users face once they've mastered the basics?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Managing multiple projects, customizing workflows, integrating with other tools.

questions.question: What advanced challenges do your most experienced users encounter?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Enterprise-level permissions, complex reporting needs, scaling to hundreds of users.

questions.question: What type of free model are you currently using?
What features are currently available in your free offering?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Up to 3 projects, basic reporting, 5 team members.

questions.question: What are the main limitations of your free model?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Limited storage, no advanced features, restrictions on team size.

questions.question: What's your current free-to-paid conversion rate?
How quickly can new users experience value with your product?
What key metrics do you track to measure the success of your free model?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Trial signups, activation rate, free-to-paid conversion rate, time to convert.

questions.question: On a scale of 1 to 10, how intentional do you feel your current free model is?
What are your main goals for your free model? (Select up to 3)
